Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient is contemplating a career change from finance due to feelings of unfulfillment and is considering teaching or mentoring as potential new paths.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient successfully delivered a presentation, which boosted their confidence. They are feeling more capable of handling similar situations in the future and are exploring new career opportunities that excite them.
Psychosocial History: The patient has been enjoying quality time with their niece and nephew, strengthening their bond. They are also improving communication with their brother by actively listening and finding common ground.
Next Steps: The patient plans to research teaching opportunities and continue nurturing family relationships.
